svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - November 18 2019

title: "Week in Eth News
November 18, 2019" date: "2019-11-18"
Eth News and Links
Eth1
• Parity v.2.5.10stable and v2.6.5beta . Ready for Istanbul, with some warp sync fixes in the beta
release
• Trinity v0.1.0-alpha.30 , Istanbul-ready py-evm
• Aleth v1.7 , Istanbul ready
• Latest core devs call . Notes from call
Eth2
• Prysmatic client update. testnet relaunch, up to spec v0.9.1
• How data availability affects light client design
• Devcon video on developer experience in eth2
Layer2
• BLS rollup on Skale
Stuff for developers
• Solidity v0.5.13 . Istanbul-EVM compatible, more SMT, list overload candidates, export layout of
storage variables, WIP ewasm-binary output
• Truffle v5.1 . ENS support, new data decoder, in-test debugging and better syntax highlighting while
debugging
• web3.js v1.2.4 better Typescript type defs, out of gas bugfix
• Vyper v0.1.beta14
• How to protect your contracts from re-entrancy after Istanbul
• How Lucidity dramatically reduced their Infura call volume by caching its reads
• Aragon’s tips for winning the struggle against contract size in the EVM
• Terminal’s dapp monitoring platform
• The architecture of Dharma’s smart wallets
• Gonçalo Sá on Solidity features in v0.5.13 and coming in v0.6
• Slick interface to buy Chainlink API data feeds
Ecosystem
• Grants: ConsenSys wave 2 , EF Taiwan focused , MetaCartel cohort 1
• Eric Conner’s user guide to ENS domains
• ethereum.org update : adding the Studio web IDE, re-org’ing the format and Gitcoin bounties
• Meson , a mixnet at the networking layer
• More Devcon5 videos are slowly trickling in
Enterprise
• Subscribing to events at scale by sending them to Kafka or Kinesis
• updated uPort roadmap , mostly aimed at enterprise
Governance and standards
• ERC2362 : Pull oracle interface
• Lessons learned from establishing Hyperledger Besu’s maintenance process
• DisCOs : the p2p community’s alternative to DAOs
• Autark’s “Open Enteprise” for Aragon is on mainnet. an “end-to-end suite of tools for management of
open organizations”
Application layer
• Brave v1 . If you haven’t switched yet, I no longer even have the "slow new tab" problem. Referral
link (though my KYC is stuck and I can’t get my BAT!) I also enjoyed Brian Bondy’s Brave founding
story . The best part is how they almost couldn’t connect by DM.
• You can sell your browser data through Swash browser extension and earn Streamr’s DATA token
• Tokenizing open offers with OpenLaw
• 0x v3 passed and goes live Nov 25
• Comparing insurance-like solutions in DeFi
• A taxonomy for LAOs (DAOs with a legal entity)
• It’s multi-collateral Dai (MCD) launch day. One of the main reasons to switch is the benefits of Dai
Savings Rate . MCD also means revamped Oasis dex
Tokens / Business / Regulation
• Convexity protocol : ERC20 option tokens
• Chainlink on embedding smart contracts into a legal fabric
General
• De-anonymization attacks from remote side channels . Applicable to Monero and ZCash
• Breaking Mimblewimble privacy for $60 a week, “and I don’t believe there’s a way to fix it.”
• Mudit Gupta’s post on problems with mixers
• Protests in Iran led to them shutting off the internet
• You have 12 days to register an Eth address to get tokenized r/ethtrader donuts
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new in bold ) :
• Nov 18 - Multi-collateral Dai launches
• Dec 2-16 - Gitcoin Global Communities virtual hackathon
• Dec 6 - Istanbul network upgrade
• Jan 1 - Augur v1 cutoff
• Jan 31 - deadline for EU ledger 200k euro grants for blockchain startups
• Feb 9-15 - EthLagos
• Feb 14-16 - ETHDenver
• Mar 3-5 - EthCC (Paris)
• Apr 3-7 - Edcon (Vienna)
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys .
I own 100% Week In Ethereum. Editorial control has always been me.
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum ,” then here’s a hint: don’t
email me. Do put it on Reddit.
It’s amazing to me how many people email me when every issue has a link at the bottom saying not to
email me to get in the newsletter.
If you're unhappy with editorial decisions or anything that I have written in this issue, feel free to
tweet at me .
I want your links: weekinethereumnews.com
Archive on the web if you’re linking to it:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-eth-news-november-18-2019/
Follow me on Twitter , because most of what is linked here gets tweeted first: @evan_van_ness
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive the weekly email
